article_title: They’re Right to Distrust U.S. Data Security
article_text:
Regarding Roslyn Layton’s “Europe’s Protectionist Privacy Advocates” (op-ed, March 10): In 2000 the U.S. assured Europe that a program of self-certification would safeguard the personal information of Europeans transferred to the U.S.

During the 15-year period of the arrangement, the incidence of data breaches and identity theft has skyrocketed in the U.S. The Federal Trade Commission just reported almost half a million complaints...
